text: Philip Morris Klutznick (July 9, 1907 â€“ August 14, 1999) was an American politician. He was the United States Secretary of Commerce from January 9, 1980 to January 19, 1981 under President Jimmy Carter. Klutznick died on August 14, 1999 in Chicago, Illinois from problems caused by Alzheimer's disease at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1907 births Category:1999 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Chicago Category:United States Secretaries of Commerce Category:Jewish American politicians Category:Politicians from Kansas City, Missouri Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Businesspeople from Chicago Category:Businesspeople from Kansas City, Missouri
title: Philip Klutznick
